sen.j: 纒向遺跡または纏向遺跡（まきむくいせき）は、奈良県桜井市、御諸山（みもろやま）とも三室山（みむろやま）とも呼ばれる三輪山の北西麓一帯に広がる弥生時代末期〜古墳時代前期の遺跡群を指す。
sen.e: Makimuku Remains ("纒向遺跡" or "纏向遺跡") is the series of remains located at the north-west foot of Miwa-yama Mountain ("三輪山." It is also called Mimoro-yama Mountain, "御諸山" or Mimuro-yama Mountain "三室山") in Sakurai-City, Nara Prefecture, which existed during the period of the last stage of Yayoi period to the early Tumulus period of ancient Japan.

Makimuku Remains ("纒向遺跡" or "纏向遺跡") is a series of remains located at the north-west foot of Mt. Miwa ("三輪山."also called Mt. Mimoro, "御諸山" or Mt. Mimuro "三室山") in Sakurai-City, Nara Prefecture, which existed during the period of the last stage of the Yayoi period to the early Tumulus period of ancient Japan.

Makimuku Remains ("纒向遺跡" or "纏向遺跡") is a series of remains located at the north-west foot of Mt. Miwa ("三輪山."also called Mt. Mimoro, "御諸山" or Mt. Mimuro "三室山") in Sakurai-City, Nara Prefecture, which existed during the period of the last stage of the Yayoi period to the early Tumulus period of ancient Japan.

sen.j: 前方後円墳発祥の地とされている。
sen.e: Those remains are considered to be the origins of the ancient Japanese tumulus of a circular shape with a rectangular frontage.
Those remains are considered to be the origins of the ancient Japanese tumuluses of a circular shape with a rectangular frontage.
Those remains are considered to be the origins of the ancient Japanese tumuluses of a circular shape with a rectangular frontage.

sen.j: 遺跡名は旧磯城郡纏向村の村名であり、その村名は垂仁天皇纏向珠城（たまき）宮、景行天皇纏向日代（ひしろ）宮の纏向に由来する。
sen.e: The name of these remains are derived from the village name of Makimuku Village located in the former Shiki District, which was named after the Makimuku Tamakinomiya Imperial Palace of Suinin Emperor and the Makimuku Hishironomiya Imperial Palace of Keiko Emperor, both located in this area.

The name of these remains is derived from the village name of Makimuku Village located in the former Shiki District, which was named after the Makimuku Tamakinomiya Imperial Palace of Emperor Suinin and the Makimuku Hishironomiya Imperial Palace of Emperor Keiko, both located in this area.

The name of these remains is derived from the village name of Makimuku Village located in the former Shiki District, which was named after the Makimuku Tamakinomiya Imperial Palace of Emperor Suinin and the Makimuku Hishironomiya Imperial Palace of Emperor Keiko, both located in this area.

sen.j: 現在（2000年代）の把握されている纒向遺跡の範囲は北は烏田川、南は五味原川、東は山辺の道に接する巻野内地区、西は東田地区およびその範囲は約3km2になる。
sen.e: The known boundary of these remains (as of the year 2000 and later) are about 3 square kilometers, which extends to the north up to Karasuda River, to the south up to Gomibara River, to the east up to Makinouchi Area close to Yamanobeno-michi Street, to the west up to Higashida Area.

The known area of these remains (as of the year 2000 and later) is about 3 square kilometers, which extends to the north up to Karasuda River, to the south up to Gomibara River, to the east up to Makinouchi Area close to Yamanobeno-michi Street, to the west up to Higashida Area.

The known area of these remains (as of the year 2000 and later) is about 3 square kilometers, which extends to the north up to Karasuda River, to the south up to Gomibara River, to the east up to Makinouchi Area close to Yamanobeno-michi Street, to the west up to Higashida Area.

sen.j: 遺跡地図上では遺跡範囲はJR巻向駅を中心に東西約2キロメートル・南北約1.5キロメートルに及び、その形は楕円形であり、面積は3000m2にまで達する。
sen.e: On the detailed map of the remains produced from the investigation, the expanse of the area is in 2km long in east-west orientation and 1.5km long in south-north orientation forming an ellipse shape, with a territory up to 3,000 square meters spreading around the location of today's JR Makumuku Station as its center.

On the detailed map of the remains produced from the investigation, the expanse of the area is 2 kilometers long in east-west orientation and 1.5 kilometers long in south-north orientation forming an ellipse shape, with an area up to 3,000 square meters spreading around the location of today's JR Makumuku Station as its center.

On the detailed map of the remains produced from the investigation, the expanse of the area is 2 kilometers long in east-west orientation and 1.5 kilometers long in south-north orientation forming an ellipse shape, with an area up to 3,000 square meters spreading around the location of today's JR Makumuku Station as its center.

sen.j: 地形は、東が高く西が低い。
sen.e: The topographic conditions of the area reveal that the east part of the territory is higher and the west part is lower.
The topographic conditions of the area reveal that the east part of the territory is higher and the west part is lower.
The topographic conditions of the area reveal that the east part of the territory is higher and the west part is lower.

sen.j: 三輪山・巻向山・穴師山などの流れが纏向川に合流し、その扇状地上に遺跡が形成されている。
sen.e: The range of the ridges and valleys of Miwa-yama Mountain, Makimuko-yama Mountain, Ynashi-yama Mountain are unified as a Makimukai River and form an alluvial fan designated as the location for the Impreial palaces.

The range of the ridges and valleys of Miwa-yama Mountain, Makimuko-yama Mountain, Ynashi-yama Mountain are unified as a Makimukai River and form an alluvial fan designated as the location for the Impreial palaces.
Mountain streams from Mt. Miwa, Mt. Makimuko, Mt. Anashi, and other mountains converge to join the Makimukai River, forming an alluvial fan where the remains are located.
sen.cmt: 山および川の表記を指示書に合わせました。

sen.j: 纒向遺跡の始まりは、縄文時代後・晩期からと推定される。
sen.e: The period of the existence of Makimuku Village could date back to the late to the final stage of the Jomon period. (the period producing earthenware with a pattern of rope)
The period of the existence of Makimuku Village could date back to the late to the final stage of the Jomon period (the period producing earthenware with a pattern of rope).
The period of the existence of Makimuku Village could date back to the late to the final stage of the Jomon period (the period producing earthenware with a pattern of rope).

sen.j: 粗製土器片やサヌカイト片に混じって砂岩製の石棒破片が土偶や深鉢などがこの遺跡のあちこちから出土していて、縄文時代の集落が営まれていたと考えられている。
sen.e: In addition to the daily-use earthware pieces and Sanukite pieces, (a stone produced in this area used for producing a sound-making instrument) some other products such as stone curved sticks, earthen figure sculptures, deep pot pieces were excavated throughout the area of the remains, which suggests the establishment of a village at this location during the Jomon period.
sen.cmt: 「〜砂岩製の石棒破片が土偶や深鉢などが〜」とありますが、「〜砂岩製の石棒破片や土偶、深鉢などが〜」と解釈しました。
sen.e: In addition to the crude earthenware pieces and Sanukite pieces (musical instrument), other products, such as stone curved sticks, earthen figure sculptures, deep pot pieces, were excavated throughout the area of the remains, which suggests the existence of a village at this location during the Jomon period.

In addition to the crude earthenware pieces and Sanukite pieces (musical instrument), other products, such as stone curved sticks, earthen figure sculptures, deep pot pieces, were excavated throughout the area of the remains, which suggests the existence of a village at this location during the Jomon period.

sen.j: この遺跡からは弥生時代の集落が発見されておらず、環濠集落も検出されていない。
sen.e: However, any evidence of a village nor a village with a moat constructed around the territory from the Yayoi period has not been found throughout the remains.
However, any evidence of a village nor a village with a moat constructed around the territory from the Yayoi period has not been found throughout the remains.
However, any evidence of a village nor a village with a moat constructed around the territory from the Yayoi period has not been found throughout the remains.

sen.j: つまり纒向遺跡の弥生時代のことはほとんど分かっていない。
sen.e: Therefore the fact of Makimuku Remains during the Yayoi period has not been well known as of today.
Therefore the fact of Makimuku Remains during the Yayoi period has not been well known as of today.
Therefore the fact of Makimuku Remains during the Yayoi period has not been well known as of today.

sen.j: 銅鐸の破片や土抗が2基発見されているのみである。
sen.e: Only some pieces of a bronze bell-shaped vessel and two set of stake marks on the ground from the Yayoi period have been discovered.
Only some pieces of a bronze bell-shaped vessel and two set of stake marks on the ground from the Yayoi period have been discovered.
Only some pieces of a bronze bell-shaped vessel and two set of stake marks on the ground from the Yayoi period have been discovered.

sen.j: この遺跡より南に少し離れた地より弥生中期・後期の多量の土器片が発見されており、方形周濠墓や竪穴住居なども出土している。
sen.e: However, many pieces of earthenware produced during the mid to the late Yayoi period have been found at the location slightly south to the Makimuku Remains, along with some other remains such as the tomb surrounded by a square moat and pit-houses.

However, many pieces of earthenware produced during the mid to the late Yayoi period have been found at the location slightly south to the Makimuku Remains, and other remains, such as tombs surrounded by a square moat and pit-houses, were excavated.

However, many pieces of earthenware produced during the mid to the late Yayoi period have been found at the location slightly south to the Makimuku Remains, and other remains, such as tombs surrounded by a square moat and pit-houses, were excavated.

sen.j: さらに南西の地から多くの遺物が出土している。
sen.e: Furthermore, many relic pieces have been excavated from the south-west location of Makimuku Remains.
Furthermore, many relics have been excavated from the south-west location of Makimuku Remains.
Furthermore, many relics have been excavated from the south-west location of Makimuku Remains.

sen.j: 纒向遺跡は、古墳時代の始まりを告げる遺跡であり、今日、邪馬台国畿内説を立証する遺跡ではないかとして注目を浴びている。
sen.e: Makimuku Remains represent the beginning of the Tumulus period in Japan, and they became the center of the attention to prove the theory that Yamataikoku was founded in Kidai region. (Kinki region)
Makimuku Remains represent the beginning of the Tumulus period in Japan, and they became the center of the attention to prove the theory that Yamataikoku was founded in Kidai region (Kinki region).
Makimuku Remains represent the beginning of the Tumulus period in Japan, and they became the center of the attention to prove the theory that Yamataikoku was founded in Kidai region (Kinki region).

sen.j: 3世紀前半の遺構は少数である。
sen.e: There are a few archelogic features remained from the first half of the 3rd century.
There are a few archeological features remained from the first half of the 3rd century.
There are a few archeological features remained from the first half of the 3rd century.

sen.j: 遺跡の最盛期は3世紀終わり頃から4世紀初めにかけてである。
sen.e: The heyday of the village of these remains were considered to be from the end of 3rd century to the first of 4th century.
The heyday of the village of these remains was considered to be from the end of the 3rd century to the first of the 4th century.
The heyday of the village of these remains was considered to be from the end of the 3rd century to the first of the 4th century.

sen.j: 農業用の大型水路や無数の土抗の中に三輪山祭祀に関する遺物のセットが多数投げ捨てられていた。
sen.e: Many set of ritual instruments used for honoring Miwa-yama Mountain were found from the remains of a large-scale agricultural channels, along with the countless number of holes on the ground.
sen.cmt: 原文で「土抗」とありますが漢字の間違いであるとおもいます。「土杭」か「土坑」と思われます。
sen.e: Many set of ritual instruments used for honoring Mt. Miwa were found from the remains of large-scale agricultural channels, along with a countless number of holes on the ground.
sen.cmt: 不定冠詞訂正しました。
sen.e: Many set of ritual instruments used for honoring Mt. Miwa were found from the remains of large-scale agricultural channels, along with a countless number of holes on the ground.

sen.j: 石塚古墳周濠から吉備系の祭祀遺物弧文円板（こもんえんばん）が出土している。
sen.e: Some relics including Kibi style Komonenban (arc patterned disc) produced for ritual usage were found from the periphery moat of Ishizuka Tumulus.
Some relics, including Kibi style Komonenban (arc patterned disc) produced for ritual usage, were found from the surrounding moat of Ishizuka Tumulus.
Some relics, including Kibi style Komonenban (arc patterned disc) produced for ritual usage, were found from the surrounding moat of Ishizuka Tumulus.

sen.j: ピークが過ぎた4世紀末には埴輪が出土する。
sen.e: From the relics considered to be produced after the prime time of the village at the end of 4th century, Haniwa style relics (a clay images) start to appear among those excavated products.
From the relics considered to be produced after the prime time of the village at the end of the 4th century, Haniwa style relics (a clay images) start to appear among those excavated products.
From the relics considered to be produced after the prime time of the village at the end of the 4th century, Haniwa style relics (a clay images) start to appear among those excavated products.

sen.j: 飛鳥〜奈良時代に入るとこの地域に市が発達し、大市と呼ばれた。
sen.e: During the period of Asuka to Nara periods, this area was developed to form a city-scale community to be called as Oichi.
In the Asuka period to the Nara period, this area was developed to form a city called Oichi.
In the Asuka period to the Nara period, this area was developed to form a city called Oichi.

sen.j: 箸墓古墳が宮内庁比定では大市墓というのはこのためである。
sen.e: This is the prime reason that Hashihaka Tumulus is presumably defined as Oichibaka (the tomb of Oichi) by the Imperial Household Agency of Japan.
This is the prime reason that Hashihaka Tumulus is presumably defined as Oichibaka (the tomb of Oichi) by the Imperial Household Agency of Japan.
This is the prime reason that Hashihaka Tumulus is presumably defined as Oichibaka (the tomb of Oichi) by the Imperial Household Agency of Japan.

sen.j: 奈良・平安時代では井戸遺構や土抗、旧河道などが検出されている。
sen.e: Some remains of wells, hole marks on the ground, and the track of a river were discovered as the remains of Nara to Heian periods.
sen.cmt: 原文で「土抗」とありますが漢字の間違いであるとおもいます。「土杭」か「土坑」と思われます。
sen.e: Some remains of wells, hole marks on the ground, and the track of a river were discovered as the remains of Nara to Heian periods.
Some remains of wells, hole marks on the ground, and the track of a river were discovered as the remains of Nara to Heian periods.

sen.j: 「大市」と墨守された土器も検出されている。
sen.e: Some pieces of earthenware written as "Oichi" in black sumi ink were also discovered.
sen.cmt: 原文にある「墨守」は「墨書」の間違いであると思われます。
sen.e: Some pieces of earthenware written as "Oichi" in black sumi ink were also discovered.
Some pieces of earthenware written as "Oichi" in black sumi ink were also discovered.

sen.j: 現在の名称で呼ばれるまでは太田遺跡・勝山遺跡として学会に知られており、小規模な遺跡群の1つとして研究者には認識され特に注目を集めていなかった。
sen.e: Until the recent extensive archelogic excavation, these remains were known as Ota Remains or Katsuyama Remains, a small-scale, insignificant remains without getting much attention among the members of Japanese archeologic societies.

Until the recent extensive archelogic excavation, these remains were known as Ota Remains or Katsuyama Remains, a small-scale, insignificant remains without getting much attention among the members of Japanese archeological societies.

Until the recent extensive archelogic excavation, these remains were known as Ota Remains or Katsuyama Remains, a small-scale, insignificant remains without getting much attention among the members of Japanese archeological societies.

sen.j: しかし1971年に行われた県営住宅、小学校建設の為の橿原考古学研究所が行った事前調査により幅5m、深さ1メートル、総延長200メートル以上の運河状の構造物が発見された事により注目を集めることになる。
sen.e: However, the atmosphere of the archeologic community changed after the operation of a preliminary excavation research by Archelological Institute of Kashihara prior to the construction of a municipal housing and an elementary school at the site; the remains got the attention of archeologic communities after the discovery of the canal style constructions in 5m width, 1m depth and the total length of 200m and more.

However, the atmosphere of the archeological community changed after the operation of a preliminary excavation research by Archelological Institute of Kashihara prior to the construction of a municipal housing and an elementary school at the site; the remains got the attention of archeological communities after the discovery of the canal style constructions in 5m width, 1m depth and the total length of 200m and more.

However, the atmosphere of the archeological community changed after the operation of a preliminary excavation research by Archelological Institute of Kashihara prior to the construction of a municipal housing and an elementary school at the site; the remains got the attention of archeological communities after the discovery of the canal style constructions in 5m width, 1m depth and the total length of 200m and more.

sen.j: その後も、さまざまな出土品が広範囲にわたって確認された。
sen.e: The excavation continued to find various remains and relics throughout the site.
The excavations continued to find various remains and relics throughout the site.
The excavations continued to find various remains and relics throughout the site.

sen.j: 1977年の第15次調査以降、調査主体が橿原考古学研究所から桜井市教育委員会へと移り現在も調査を継続している。
sen.e: After the 15th excavation research operated in 1977, the primary body of the research was handed over from the Archeological Institute of Kashihara to the Sakurai City Board of Education to succeed and continue the research, and the excavation still continues as of today.

After the 15th excavation carried out in 1977, the primary body of the researches was handed over from the Archeological Institute of Kashihara to the Sakurai City Board of Education to succeed and continue the researches, and excavations still continue today.

After the 15th excavation carried out in 1977, the primary body of the researches was handed over from the Archeological Institute of Kashihara to the Sakurai City Board of Education to succeed and continue the researches, and excavations still continue today.

sen.j: 2009年にはいくつかの建物も発掘され、纒向遺跡は柵や砦で囲まれた都市の一部らしいことが明らかになってきた。
sen.e: In 2009, some new remains of the buildings were found, which would be the evidences of Makimuku Remains as the developed, civilized urban community surrounded and protected by fences and fortifications.
In 2009, some new remains of the buildings were found, which would be evidences of Makimuku Remains as a developed, civilized urban community surrounded and protected by fences and fortifications.
In 2009, some new remains of the buildings were found, which would be evidences of Makimuku Remains as a developed, civilized urban community surrounded and protected by fences and fortifications.

sen.j: 主な遺構
sen.e: Major archeologic features
Major archeologic features
Major archeologic features

sen.j: 唐古・鍵遺跡の約10倍の規模を持ち、藤原宮に匹敵する巨大な遺跡で多賀城跡よりも大規模である。
sen.e: Makimuku Remains are in enormous scale and have about the 10 times in the scale compared to Karako/Kagi Remains; Makimuku Remains are comparable to the scale of Fujiwara Palace, and larger than Taga Castle Remains.
Makimuku Remains are enormous and 10 times as large as the Karako/Kagi Remains, are comparable to the scale of Fujiwara Palace, and larger than the Taga Castle Remains.
Makimuku Remains are enormous and 10 times as large as the Karako/Kagi Remains, are comparable to the scale of Fujiwara Palace, and larger than the Taga Castle Remains.

sen.j: 都市計画のなされていた痕跡と考えられる遺構が随所で確認されている。
sen.e: Multiple archeologic features revealing the vestige of a urban planning have been discovered.
Multiple archeological features revealing the vestige of an urban planning have been discovered.
sen.cmt: 用語変更、スペルミスに対応しました。
sen.e: Multiple archeological features revealing the vestige of an urban planning have been discovered.

sen.j: 矢板で護岸した幅5メートル、深さ1メートル、総延長200メートル以上にわたる巨大水路の発見。
sen.e: An enormous water channel was discovered, which measures in 5m width, 1m depth and 200m in total length with wooden sheet piles protecting its banks.
An enormous water channel was discovered, which measures 5m in width, 1m in depth and 200m in total length, with wooden sheet piles protecting its banks.
An enormous water channel was discovered, which measures 5m in width, 1m in depth and 200m in total length, with wooden sheet piles protecting its banks.

sen.j: 底からは湧水がみられ、内部は大きく分けて3層に分かれている。
sen.e: Water springs out from the bottom of the water channel, and the inside of the channel is largely divided into three layers.
sen.cmt: 原文の説明不足で「内部」の示すものが水路自体についてなのか、水路周辺についてなのか不明です。（例えばこの水路の下部の湧水部分、実際水の流れる水路部分、そして護岸部分という意味での3層）英訳はこのため直訳にしております。
sen.e: Water springs out from the bottom of the water channel, and the inside of the channel is largely divided into three layers.
Water springs out from the bottom of the water channel, and the inside of the channel is largely divided into three layers.

sen.j: 径約3メートル・深さ約1.5メートルの一方が突出する不整形な円の土抗が約150基発見された。
sen.e: As many as 150 stake marks were found on the ground, which measure in 3m diameter and 1.5m deep distorted circles protruding into one direction.
As many as 150 stake marks of irregular circles protruding into one direction were found on the ground, each of which measures 3m in diameter and 1.5m in depth.
As many as 150 stake marks of irregular circles protruding into one direction were found on the ground, each of which measures 3m in diameter and 1.5m in depth.

sen.j: 掘立柱建物跡と、これに附随する建物跡。
sen.e: The remains of a pile building and some accompanying constructions have been excavated. (Those remains excavated in this area are considered to be produced in the first half of the early Tumulus period, constructed in about 23 sqm in 3.6m x 5.45m dimention, and also some other accompanying remains have been excavated including; an archeologic feature representing the sign of a collapsed building, along with a wooden artifact in black lacquer with arc patterns; a small building in 1.8m x 1.8m dimention; another 3.6m x 3.6m all-pillared building along with black lacquered, arc patterned wooden relics; 17 other pit-dwellings; stone monument of Makimuku Tamashiro Palace Remains; it may be inferred from these artifacts that a buildings of a major palace existed at this location.
sen.cmt: 文章最後の方、「〜宮殿居館の存在が疑われる。」とありますが、これがその直接前にある「〜纏向玉城宮跡の石碑」によって宮殿の存在が推測されているのか、これら遺跡全体から宮殿の存在が推測されるのかが文章構成からはわかりません。ここでは遺跡全体から宮殿の存在が推測される、という意味合いで訳しました。また、「〜存在が疑われる。」は間違いではないと思いますが、通常は怪しむ、訝る、嫌疑といった意味で使われます。
sen.e: The remains of a pile building and some accompanying constructions have been excavated. (Those remains excavated in this area are considered to be produced in the first half of the early Tumulus period, constructed in about 23 square meters in 3.6 meters x 5.45 meters dimention, and also some other accompanying remains have been excavated including; an archeological feature representing a sign of a collapsed building, along with a wooden artifact in black lacquer with arc patterns; a small building measuring 1.8 meters x 1.8 meters; another 3.6 meters x 3.6 meters all-pillared building along with black lacquered, arc patterned wooden relics; 17 other pit-dwellings; stone monument of Makimuku Tamashiro Palace Remains; it may be inferred from these artifacts that buildings of a major palace existed at this location.
The remains of a pile building and some accompanying constructions have been excavated.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理

sen.j: （古墳時代前期前半の2×3間で床面積約23平方メートルの建物、家屋倒壊遺構と黒漆塗りの弧文を持つ木製品、1×1間の小家屋と2×2間の総柱建物と弧文黒漆塗木製品、纏向玉城宮跡の石碑、宮殿居館の存在が疑われる。)
sen.e: (Those remains excavated in this area are considered to be produced in the first half of the early Tumulus period, constructed in about 23 square meters in 3.6 meters x 5.45 meters dimention, and also some other accompanying remains have been excavated including; an archeological feature representing a sign of a collapsed building, along with a wooden artifact in black lacquer with arc patterns; a small building measuring 1.8 meters x 1.8 meters; another 3.6 meters x 3.6 meters all-pillared building along with black lacquered, arc patterned wooden relics; it may be inferred from these artifacts that buildings of a major palace existed at this location.)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理

sen.j: (その他に掘立建物17棟検出）
sen.e: (17 other pit-dwellings; stone monument of Makimuku Tamashiro Palace Remains.)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理

sen.j: 竪穴式住居発見され始めている。
sen.e: The continuing excavation has started to discover the remains of some pit-dwellings.
sen.cmt: 原文ですが、「竪穴式住居発見され始めている。」は「竪穴式住居が発見され始めている。」と解釈しました。
sen.e: The continuing excavation has started to discover the remains of some pit-dwellings.
The continuing excavation has started to discover the remains of some pit-dwellings.

sen.j: 弧文板・土塁と柵列を伴ったV字形の区画溝
sen.e: V-shaped zoning ditches constructed with arc patterned wooden planks, earthwork, embankment, and fences constructed along with the ditches have been excavated.
V-shaped zoning ditches constructed with arc patterned wooden planks, earthwork, embankment, and fences constructed along with ditches have been excavated.
V-shaped zoning ditches constructed with arc patterned wooden planks, earthwork, embankment, and fences constructed along with ditches have been excavated.

sen.j: 導水施設跡
sen.e: Remains of water conveyance facility have been discovered. (It is inferred from the artifacts that the ditches were used as a drainage channels of the palace)
Remains of water conveyance facility have been discovered.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Remains of water conveyance facility have been discovered.

sen.j: （宮殿の排水施設か）
sen.e: (It is inferred from the artifacts that the ditches were used as a drainage channels of the palace.)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: (It is inferred from the artifacts that the ditches were used as a drainage channels of the palace.)

sen.j: 遺跡内に点在する古墳（纏向古墳群）
sen.e: The dispersely existing tumulus within the boundary of the remains (Makimuku Tumuluses)
The dispersedly existing tumulus within the boundary of the remains (Makimuku Tumuluses)
sen.cmt: スペルミスに対応しました。
sen.e: The dispersedly existing tumulus within the boundary of the remains (Makimuku Tumuluses)

sen.j: 祭祀遺跡（穴師ドヨド地区の景行天皇纏向日代宮の伝承地から碧玉製勾玉・石釧・管玉・ガラス小玉、4世紀後半の土器など出土）
sen.e: The remains of a ritual place (From the location of Makimuku Hishiro Imperial Palace of Keiko Emperor described by the Imperial tradition, some artifacts have been discovered such as a jasper Magatama, stone Kushiro, jasper Kudatama, (for threaded necklace) glass beeds, and the earthenware from the late 4th century.

The remains of a ritual place (from the location of Makimuku Hishiro Imperial Palace of Emperor Keiko described by the Imperial tradition, some artifacts have been discovered, such as a jasper Magatama, stone Kushiro, jasper Kudatama (for threaded necklace), glass beads, and the earthenware from the late 4th century.
sen.cmt: スペルミスに対応しました。
sen.e: The remains of a ritual place (from the location of Makimuku Hishiro Imperial Palace of Emperor Keiko described by the Imperial tradition, some artifacts have been discovered, such as a jasper Magatama, stone Kushiro, jasper Kudatama (for threaded necklace), glass beads, and the earthenware from the late 4th century.

sen.j: 現在は確認できない埋没古墳が多数ある可能性あり。
sen.e: There are possibilities that many tumulus are still buried under the ground, yet to be discovered.
There are possibilities that many tumuluses are still buried under the ground, yet to be discovered.
sen.cmt: 単複間違いに対応しました。
sen.e: There are possibilities that many tumuluses are still buried under the ground, yet to be discovered.

sen.j: 主な遺物
sen.e: Major artifacts
Major artifacts
Major artifacts

sen.j: 朱色に塗った鶏形木製品
sen.e: Rooster shaped wooden products colored in vermillion were excavated.
Rooster shaped wooden products colored in vermillion were excavated.
Rooster shaped wooden products colored in vermillion were excavated.

sen.j: 吉備地方にルーツを持つとされる直線と曲線を組合わせて文様を施した弧文円板（こもねんばん）と呼ばれる木の埴輪。
sen.e: Some wooden haniwa originary came from Kibi region have been discovered, which is called Komon Enban (arc patterned disc) from their patterns created by the combination of linear and curved lines.
sen.cmt: 原文の「弧文円板」の読み部分、「こもねんばん」とありますが「こもんえんばん」の間違いかと思われます。
sen.e: Some wooden haniwa originally came from the Kibi region have been discovered, which is called Komon Enban (arc patterned disc) from their patterns created by the combination of linear and curved lines.
sen.cmt: スペルミスに対応しました。
sen.e: Some wooden haniwa originally came from the Kibi region have been discovered, which is called Komon Enban (arc patterned disc) from their patterns created by the combination of linear and curved lines.

sen.j: 絹製の巾着袋
sen.e: A drawstring purse made in silk fabric was discovered.
A drawstring purse made in silk fabric was discovered.
A drawstring purse made in silk fabric was discovered.

sen.j: 瓦質土器
sen.e: Pieces of earthenware made from a roof-tile material were discovered.
Pieces of earthenware made of a roof-tile material were discovered.
Pieces of earthenware made of a roof-tile material were discovered.

sen.j: （1996年に土器片の発見。)
sen.e: (In 1996, some pieces of earthenware were excavated. In 2001, according to the analysis of the soil component of the earthenware, there is no similar instance among the earthenware produced in Japan, therefore the excavated earthenware pieces were identified that those had been produce by the techniques and methods invented in the Korean Peninsula.

(In 1996, some pieces of earthenware were excavated. In 2001, according to the analysis of the soil components of the earthenware, there is no similar instance among the earthenware produced in Japan, therefore the excavated earthenware pieces were identified that they had been produced with the techniques and methods invented in the Korean Peninsula.)
(In 1996, some pieces of earthenware were excavated.)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理

sen.j: (胎土成分組成の分析により、2001年に国内で類例のない事が確認され、朝鮮半島内の技術で作られたものと判明した）
sen.e: (In 2001, according to the analysis of the soil components of the earthenware, there is no similar instance among the earthenware produced in Japan, therefore the excavated earthenware pieces were identified that they had been produced with the techniques and methods invented in the Korean Peninsula.)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理

sen.j: ミニチュアの舟
sen.e: Miniature scale boat
Miniature scale boat
Miniature scale boat

sen.j: 木製鏃
sen.e: Wooden arrowhead
Wooden arrowhead
Wooden arrowhead

sen.j: 搬入土器
sen.e: Earthenware brought from other regions of Japan
Earthenware brought from other regions of Japan
Earthenware brought from other regions of Japan

sen.j: 石見型楯形（いわみがたたてがた）木製品
sen.e: Iwami style shield-shaped wooden products
Iwami style shield-shaped wooden products
Iwami style shield-shaped wooden products

sen.j: 日本全国で作られたと見なされる遺物が出土しているが、中でも東海地方の物が多い。
sen.e: While many artifacts produced in various regions of ancient Japan have been excavated in Makimuku remains, the products brought from Tokai region have the largest volume among of all those artifacts.
While many artifacts produced in various regions of ancient Japan have been excavated in Makimuku remains, the products brought from Tokai region have the largest volume among of all those artifacts.
While many artifacts produced in various regions of ancient Japan have been excavated in Makimuku remains, the products brought from Tokai region have the largest volume among of all those artifacts.

sen.j: 特異な遺跡
sen.e: A peculiar, unique characters of the remains
Unique characters of the remains
Unique characters of the remains

sen.j: 纒向遺跡は大集落と言われながらも、人の住む集落跡が発見されていない。
sen.e: Although Makimuku Remains are considered to have been a large-scale community, the sign of the village has not been discovered yet.
Although Makimuku Remains are considered to have been a large-scale community, the sign of the village has not been discovered yet.
Although Makimuku Remains are considered to have been a large-scale community, the sign of the village has not been discovered yet.

sen.j: 現在発見されているのは祭祀用と考えられる建物と土抗、そして弧文円板や鶏形木製品などの祭祀用具、物流のためのヒノキの矢板で護岸された大・小溝（運河）などである。
sen.e: What have been discovered in Makimuku Remains are the followings; the signs of a building considered to be built for ritual purpose and its pile marks on the ground; the ritual instruments such as the rooster-shaped wooden products, the arc-patterned discs; large and small-scale water channels protected by wooden sheet piles produceded by Japanese cypress, which had been used as a distribution system.
sen.cmt: 原文で「土抗」とありますが漢字の間違いであるとおもいます。「土杭」か「土坑」と思われます。
sen.e: What have been discovered in Makimuku Remains are as follows; the signs of a building considered to be built for ritual purposes and its pile marks on the ground; the ritual instruments, such as the rooster-shaped wooden products, the arc-patterned discs; large and small-scale water channels protected with wooden sheet piles made of Japanese cypress, which had been used as a distribution system.

What have been discovered in Makimuku Remains are as follows; the signs of a building considered to be built for ritual purposes and its pile marks on the ground; the ritual instruments, such as the rooster-shaped wooden products, the arc-patterned discs; large and small-scale water channels protected with wooden sheet piles made of Japanese cypress, which had been used as a distribution system.

sen.j: 遺跡の性格としては居住域というよりも、頻繁に人々や物資が集まったり箸墓古墳を中心とした三輪山などへの祭祀のための聖地と考える学者も多い。
sen.e: There are also many scholars suggesting that these remains were the evidences that this place functioned as a hub for the people and the products to be redistributed, or as a sacred place for performing rituals around Hashihaka Tumulus toward Miwa-yama Mountain, rather than the place provided for residential purpose.

There are also many scholars suggesting that these remains were the evidences that this place functioned as a hub for the people and the products to be redistributed, or as a sacred place for performing rituals around Hashihaka Tumulus toward Mt. Miwa, rather than the place provided for residential purposes.

There are also many scholars suggesting that these remains were the evidences that this place functioned as a hub for the people and the products to be redistributed, or as a sacred place for performing rituals around Hashihaka Tumulus toward Mt. Miwa, rather than the place provided for residential purposes.

sen.j: 辻・トリイ前地区でほぼ南北に2×3間の掘立柱建物とその南に東西に並ぶ柵列が、太田南飛塚地区で家屋倒壊遺構が、巻野内家ツラ地区で1×1間の小家屋と2×2間の総柱の建物が検出されている。
sen.e: In Tsuji/Tori front areas, the remains of some constructions have been discovered including an all-pillared building in 3.6m x 5.45m dimention spanning in south-north orientation along with a line of a fence extending in east-west orientation; in Ota Minamitobizuka area, a sign of collapsed building was discovered; in Makinouchi Ietsura area, a small building in 1.8m x 1.8m dimention, and another 3.6m x 3.6m all-pillared building have been discovered.

In Tsuji/Tori front areas, the remains of some constructions have been discovered including an all-pillared building measuring 3.6 meters x 5.45 meters spanning in south-north orientation along with a line of a fence extending in east-west orientation; in Ota Minamitobizuka area, a sign of collapsed building was discovered; in Makinouchi Ietsura area, a small building measuring 1.8 meters x 1.8 meters, and another all-pillared building measuring 3.6 meters x 3.6 meters have been discovered.

In Tsuji/Tori front areas, the remains of some constructions have been discovered including an all-pillared building measuring 3.6 meters x 5.45 meters spanning in south-north orientation along with a line of a fence extending in east-west orientation; in Ota Minamitobizuka area, a sign of collapsed building was discovered; in Makinouchi Ietsura area, a small building measuring 1.8 meters x 1.8 meters, and another all-pillared building measuring 3.6 meters x 3.6 meters have been discovered.

sen.j: このほか太田メグリ地区では、掘立柱建物が17棟が、東田柿ノ木地区・太田飛塚地で竪穴住居跡が発見されている。
sen.e: Other than those discoveries, the remains of 17 all-pillared buildings from Ota Meguri area, and some pit-dwellings from Ota Tobizuka area have been discovered.
Other than those discoveries, the remains of 17 all-pillared buildings from Ota Meguri area, and some pit-dwellings from Ota Tobizuka area have been discovered.
Other than those discoveries, the remains of 17 all-pillared buildings from Ota Meguri area, and some pit-dwellings from Ota Tobizuka area have been discovered.

sen.j: 纒向遺跡の主な古墳
sen.e: Major tumulus of Makimuku Remains
Major tumulus of Makimuku Remains
Major tumulus of Makimuku Remains

sen.j: 纒向勝山古墳
sen.e: Makimuku Katsuyama Tumulus
Makimuku Katsuyama Tumulus
Makimuku Katsuyama Tumulus

sen.j: 纒向矢塚古墳
sen.e: Makimuku Yazuka Tumulus
Makimuku Yazuka Tumulus
Makimuku Yazuka Tumulus

sen.j: 纒向石塚古墳
sen.e: Makimuku Ishizuka Tumulus
Makimuku Ishizuka Tumulus
Makimuku Ishizuka Tumulus

sen.j: 東田大塚古墳
sen.e: Higashida Otsuka Tumulus
Higashida Otsuka Tumulus
Higashida Otsuka Tumulus

sen.j: 箸墓古墳
sen.e: Hasihaka Tumulus
Hasihaka Tumulus
Hasihaka Tumulus

sen.j: ホケノ山古墳
sen.e: Hokeno-yama Mountain Tumulus
Hokeno-yama Mountain Tumulus
Hokeno-yama Mountain Tumulus

sen.j: 木製品の年輪年代測定などから、纒向石塚古墳は遅くとも225年頃までには築造されていたことが判明している。
sen.e: According to the analysis of the tree annual rings of the wooden artifacts, Makimuku Ishizuka Tumulus was constructed by as late as 225.
According to the tree-ring dating (dendrochronology) of the wooden artifacts, Makimuku Ishizuka Tumulus was constructed by 225 at the latest.
According to the tree-ring dating (dendrochronology) of the wooden artifacts, Makimuku Ishizuka Tumulus was constructed by 225 at the latest.

tit.j: 邪馬台国畿内説の最有力候補地
tit.e: It is considered that this Tumulus is the most convincing candidate site for the theory stating Yamataikoku to be located in Kinai region.
It is considered that this Tumulus is the most convincing candidate site for the theory that states that Yamataikoku was located in the Kinai region.
It is considered that this Tumulus is the most convincing candidate site for the theory that states that Yamataikoku was located in the Kinai region.

sen.j: 弥生時代末期から古墳時代前期にかけてであり、邪馬台国の時期と重なる。
sen.e: The evidences of the remains suggest that the possible period of the presence of the village is from the final stage of the Yayoi period to the early Tumulus period, which overlaps with the period of the reign of Yamataikoku.

The evidences of the remains suggest that the possible period of the presence of the village is from the final stage of the Yayoi period to the early Tumulus period, which overlaps with the period of the reign of Yamataikoku.

The evidences of the remains suggest that the possible period of the presence of the village is from the final stage of the Yayoi period to the early Tumulus period, which overlaps with the period of the reign of Yamataikoku.

sen.j: 当時としては広大な面積を持つ最大級の集落跡であり、一種の都市遺跡である。
sen.e: The remains suggest the scale of this village as one of the biggest among other villages in Japan during that time, considering its large territory area with those clear signs of developed urban planning.
The remains suggest the this village was one of the biggest villages in Japan during that time, considering its large territory area with the clear signs of developed urban planning.
The remains suggest the this village was one of the biggest villages in Japan during that time, considering its large territory area with the clear signs of developed urban planning.

sen.j: 3世紀を通じて搬入土器の量・範囲ともに他に例がなく出土土器全体の15%は駿河・尾張・近江・北陸・山陰・吉備などで生産された搬入土器で占められ、製作地域は南関東から九州北部までの広域に拡がっており、西日本の中心的位置を占める遺跡であったことは否定できないし、人々の交流センター的な役割を果たしていたことが窺える。
sen.e: The quantity and the extent of the regions bringing in the earthenware found in Makimuku Remains throughout the 3rd century is not comparable to that of the other regions; 15% of the excavated earthenware is brought from wide variety of regions in Japanthe from Suruga, Owari, Ohmi, Hokuriku, Sanin to Kibi regions; thus, this particular village would have been the center of the physical distribution and the cultural exchange among communities during that period.
sen.cmt: 「3世紀を通じて搬入土器の量・範囲ともに他に例がなく〜」の本意がわかりづらいので直訳せざるを得ませでした。
sen.e: The quantity and the extent of the regions bringing in the earthenware found in Makimuku Remains throughout the 3rd century is not comparable to that of the other regions; 15% of the excavated earthenware is brought from wide variety of regions in Japan from Suruga, Owari, Ohmi, Hokuriku, Sanin to Kibi regions; thus, this particular village would have been the center of the physical distribution and the cultural exchange among communities during that period.
sen.cmt: スペルミス、NGに対応しました。
sen.e: The quantity and the extent of the regions bringing in the earthenware found in Makimuku Remains throughout the 3rd century is not comparable to that of the other regions; 15% of the excavated earthenware is brought from wide variety of regions in Japan from Suruga, Owari, Ohmi, Hokuriku, Sanin to Kibi regions; thus, this particular village would have been the center of the physical distribution and the cultural exchange among communities during that period.

sen.j: このことは当時の王権（首長連合、邪馬台国連合）の本拠地が、この纒向地域にあったと考えられる。
sen.e: The studies presumably suggest that the stronghold of the sovereignty of that day (the alliance of chiefs, the Alliance of Yamataikoku) was situated in this Makimuku area.
The studies presumably suggest that the stronghold of the sovereignty (the alliance of chiefs, the Alliance of Yamataikoku) of that day was situated in this Makimuku area.
The studies presumably suggest that the stronghold of the sovereignty (the alliance of chiefs, the Alliance of Yamataikoku) of that day was situated in this Makimuku area.

sen.j: 伝承では倭迹迹日百襲姫命の墓とされる箸墓古墳があり、これは墳丘長280メートルに及ぶ巨大前方後円墳である。
sen.e: According to the Imperial tradition, there is Hashihaka Tumulus that is considered to be the tomb of Yamato Totohimomo Sohimenomikoto Imperial Princess, and this tomb would be an enormouse tumulus of a circular shape with a rectangular frontage, with a length of 280m in total.

There was a Hashihaka Tumulus that is considered to be the tomb of Yamato Totohimomo Sohimenomikoto no Mikoto (Imperial Princess) according to an imperial tradition, and this tomb was an enormous tumulus of a circular shape with a rectangular frontage, with a total length of 280 meters.

There was a Hashihaka Tumulus that is considered to be the tomb of Yamato Totohimomo Sohimenomikoto no Mikoto (Imperial Princess) according to an imperial tradition, and this tomb was an enormous tumulus of a circular shape with a rectangular frontage, with a total length of 280 meters.

sen.j: それに先駆けて築造された憤丘長90メートル前後の纒向型前方後円墳も3世紀では列島最大の憤丘規模を持つ。
sen.e: A tomb constructed earlier to Hashihaka Tumulus was also produced in Makimuku style tumulus of a circular shape with a rectangular frontage in the length of 90m, which is one of the biggest in its scale among other tombs produced in Japan during 3rd century.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。「憤丘長90メートル」や「憤丘規模」の「憤」は「墳」の間違いです。
sen.e: A tomb constructed earlier to Hashihaka Tumulus was also produced in Makimuku style tumulus of a circular shape with a rectangular frontage in the length of 90m, which is one of the biggest in its scale among other tombs produced in Japan during 3rd century.

Makimuku-style tumuli, which are circular in shape and have a rectangular frontage with a length of around 90 m, were constructed earlier than the Hashihaka Tumulus and are some of the largest tumuli to have been constructed in Japan during 3rd century.
sen.cmt: 原文に従って順序を変えました。.

sen.j: ヤマト王権最初の大王墓であり各地にも纒向型前方後円墳が築造され、政治的関係で結ばれていたとも考えられている。
sen.e: That was the first tomb of a great king in the Yamato Sovereignty, and the Makimuku style tumulus was introduced to other regions, which suggest the establishment of political alliances throughout Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: That was the first tomb of a great king in the Yamato Sovereignty, and the Makimuku style tumuluses were built in other regions, which suggest the establishment of political alliances throughout Japan.

That was the first tomb of a great king in the Yamato Sovereignty, and the Makimuku style tumuluses were built in other regions, which suggest the establishment of political alliances throughout Japan.

sen.j: 倭迹迹日百襲姫命はまた、邪馬台国の女王・卑弥呼とする説がある（肥後和男『邪馬台国は大和である』秋田書店）。
sen.e: There is a theory that Yamato Totohimomo Sohimenomikoto Imperial Princess was the queen of Yamataikoku, namely Himiko. ('Yamataikoku is Yamato,' Kazuo HIGO, Akita Shotten.)
There is a theory that states that Yamato Totohimomo Sohimenomikoto no Mikoto (Imperial Princess) was a queen of Yamataikoku, namely Himiko. ('Yamataikoku is Yamato,' Kazuo HIGO, Akita Shotten.)
There is a theory that states that Yamato Totohimomo Sohimenomikoto no Mikoto (Imperial Princess) was a queen of Yamataikoku, namely Himiko ('Yamataikoku is Yamato,' Kazuo HIGO, Akita Shoten).

sen.j: 以上の点から邪馬台国畿内説の有力候補地と見なされている。
sen.e: Judging from those points, Makimuku Remains are considered to be the most convincing candidate site for the theory suggesting Yamataikoku to be located in Kinai region.
Judging from those points, Makimuku Remains are considered to be the most convincing candidate site for the theory that suggests that Yamataikoku was located in the Kinai region.
Judging from those points, Makimuku Remains are considered to be the most convincing candidate site for the theory that suggests that Yamataikoku was located in the Kinai region.

sen.j: ヤマト政権発祥の地
sen.e: The birth place of Yamato Government
The birth place of Yamato Government
The birth place of Yamato Government

sen.j: 『記紀』では崇神天皇・垂仁天皇・景行天皇の磯城瑞籬（しきみずがき）宮、纏向珠城（まきむくたまき）宮、纏向日代（まきむくひしろ）宮が存在した伝えられ、さらに雄略の長谷（泊瀬）朝倉宮、欽明の師木（磯城）島大宮（金刺宮）なども存在した。
sen.e: According to "Kiki," ("記紀," which is the general term for calling the major historic books of "Kojiki" ("古事記") and "Nihonshoki ("日本書紀")) Skimizugakinomiya Palace of Sujin Emperor, Makimuku Tamakinomiya Palace of Suinin Emperor, and Makimuku Hisironomiya Palace of Keiko Emperor used to exist, and also some other palaces such as Hatsuseno Asakuranomiya Palace of Yuryaku Emperor, Shikishimano omiya (Kanasasinomiya) Palace of Kinmei Empeor are mentioned for their existence in the records.
sen.cmt: 1. 「〜纏向日代（まきむくひしろ）宮が存在した伝えられ」とありますが、「〜纏向日代（まきむくひしろ）宮が存在したと伝えられ」の間違いと思われます。2. 原文前半では「崇神天皇」らに「天皇」が付記されていますが、なぜか後半の「雄略」らの天皇には「天皇」表記がありません。
sen.e: According to "Kiki," ("記紀," which is the general term for calling the major historic books of "Kojiki" ("古事記") and "Nihonshoki ("日本書紀")) Skimizugakinomiya Palace of Emperor Sujin, Makimuku Tamakinomiya Palace of Emperor Suinin, and Makimuku Hisironomiya Palace of Emperor Keiko used to exist, and also some other palaces, such as Hatsuseno Asakuranomiya Palace of Emperor Yuryaku, Shikishimano omiya (Kanasasinomiya) Palace of Emperor Kinmei are mentioned for their existence in the records.

According to "Kiki," ("記紀," which is the general term for calling the major historic books of "Kojiki" ("古事記") and "Nihonshoki ("日本書紀")) Skimizugakinomiya Palace of Emperor Sujin, Makimuku Tamakinomiya Palace of Emperor Suinin, and Makimuku Hisironomiya Palace of Emperor Keiko used to exist, and also some other palaces, such as Hatsuseno Asakuranomiya Palace of Emperor Yuryaku, Shikishimano omiya (Kanasasinomiya) Palace of Emperor Kinmei are mentioned for their existence in the records.

sen.j: 『万葉集』にも纒向の地名がみられる歌が数多く詠まれている。
sen.e: In "Manyoshu," (the oldest book of collecting Waka, one of the popular traditional Japanese poetry styles) various poets took the name of this historic place, Makimuku, as the theme of their poetry.
In "Manyoshu" (the oldest book of collecting Waka, one of the popular traditional Japanese poetry styles), various poets took the name of this historic place, Makimuku, as the theme of their poetry.
sen.cmt: 文法ミスに対応しました。
sen.e: In "Manyoshu" (the oldest book of collecting Waka, one of the popular traditional Japanese poetry styles), various poets took the name of this historic place, Makimuku, as the theme of their poetry.
